title: swarm/fuse: Creating and editing sqlite db on fuse mount fails (local dpa)
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.7.1
OS & Version: Linux 4.11.3-1-ARCH
Commit hash :  #05101641
Sqlite : 2.8.17, 3.19.3

#### Expected behaviour

1) Executing `sqlite foo.db` on a `fuse` mount creates a new db file, and creating a table in this db should write to the file and update the db.
2) Inserting rows in an `sqlite` db copied to a `fuse` mount should write to the file and update the db.

#### Actual behaviour

1) Table creation fails:
  * sqlite2: "Database full" and returns to sqlite cli prompt.
  * sqlite3: "unable to open database 'foo.db": disk I/O error" and terminates to system prompt ($? == 1)
2) Row insertion fails:
  * sqlite2: "Database full" and returns to sqlite cli prompt.
  * sqlite3: "Disk IO error" and returns to sqlite cli prompt + _Backend panics_

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Run generic mount script (SIGINT it after completed steps):

https://gist.github.com/nolash/f4ef109455916a5e67166589c56d689d

then...

----

1) 

```
$ cd /mnt/fuse
$ sqlite /mnt/fuse/foo.db
sqlite> create table foo (id int unsigned not null);
```

<details>
<summary>log for sqlite2</summary>

-----

2) 

```
$ sqlite ~/foo.db
sqlite> create table foo (id int unsigned not null);
sqlite> .q
$ cp ~/foo.db /mnt/fuse/
$ sqlite /mnt/fuse/foo.db
sqlite> insert into foo values (1);
```
